CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 16, 1957, pg. 3, reads: "Typical Defects - Cardboard in top portion of door window, or no window pane or covering at all, is typical of many windows and doors in dwellings. Plumbing has been patched by running drain pipe and water line into hall from bathroom..  Note stained wallpaper.  Paint is very dirty throughout both houses."
TitMainTitle: Interior of dilapidated apartment stairwell with water stained wallpaper, exposed pipes on left, and door with cardboard pane, 1015 Western Avenue, Northside
